pr_title: (PLUGIN-114) Added COUNTDISTINCT function to count the distinct value…

timeline.bodyText:
this will only work for some field types. Those types should be validated at configure time, and again at prepare time if it couldn't be checked at configure time due to macros. More specifically, this will not "work" except on ints, longs, strings, floats, and doubles. And for floats and doubles, it doesn't really make much sense.
If it needs to work for other types, it is quite a bit more complex.
timeline.author: albertshau
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,55 @@

+package io.cdap.plugin.batch.aggregator.function;
+
+import io.cdap.cdap.api.data.format.StructuredRecord;
+import io.cdap.cdap.api.data.schema.Schema;
+
+import java.util.HashSet;
+import java.util.Set;
+
+/**
+ * Count distinct values of a specific column
+ */
+public class CountDistinct implements AggregateFunction<Integer> {
+  private final String fieldName;
+  private Set<Object> collectSet;

replies.bodyText: @albertshau can you explain why we'd need to validate specific types? most of the use cases I can think of would be satisfied with strings, ints, longs, floats and doubles. Perhaps booleans in addition. But I'm unable to follow why it wouldn't work for others, and by others you mean the other types in the Schema object, right?
replies.author: bdmogal

timeline.bodyText: a little better to have the Set as final and create it in the constructor, and clear it here.
timeline.author: albertshau

timeline.bodyText: is it possible for this to be false at this point? seems like it wouldn't be.
timeline.author: albertshau

replies.bodyText: ah! the macro check for aggregates is kind of in the weeds so I missed it. Removed it.
replies.author: bdmogal

timeline.bodyText:
does it really make sense to allow float and double? It could potentially go out of memory easily, with 0.000001 different than 0.00000001, etc.
In Java when you check equality of floats and doubles most IDEs will flag it as a warning.
timeline.author: albertshau

replies.bodyText: though i guess the same could be set for CollectSet. We probably need a way to collect warnings and failures, with this falling under the warning category.
replies.author: albertshau

replies.bodyText: Reported an improvement. https://issues.cask.co/browse/CDAP-16418. However, at this point, I don't think we need to absorb the risk of an OOM. I've removed support for FLOAT and DOUBLE right now. Can add it if someone brings up a use case explicitly.
replies.author: bdmogal

timeline.message: (PLUGIN-114) Added COUNTDISTINCT function to count the distinct values in a column
(PLUGIN-114) Added COUNTDISTINCT function to count the distinct values in a column
